results.title: Janus. Eps 25 and 26: Mute by visitation. Elements of murder
results.creator_credit: Kate Woods, Mandy Smith, Bill Hughes and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Janus”.
Episodes 25 and 26 of the television series Janus. “Mute by visitation” (50 mins) (directed by Mandy Smith). Glenda de Bono is listed to preside as Judge on a retrial of a rape case. This is her first major trial since becoming a County Judge. The unusual aspect of this trial however, is that both the victim, Colleen Maitland (Danni Wright) and the alleged rapist, Tim Lester (Mike Canfield) are profoundly deaf - so are their families and the witnesses. Meanwhile, application for Mal Hennessey’s blood sample for DNA testing is granted and Peter Faithful gets a bonus when “Gazza”, during his interview, puts Shirl Hennessey in the picture as the one to organise the disposal of Patrick Clancy’s body. “Elements of murder” (51 mins) (directed by Kate Woods) is the final episode of Janus. Mal Hennessey and Shirl Hennessey face a commital hearing - Mal for murder and Shirl for accessory after the fact to murder. The use of DNA as corroborating material, and Sandy (Mal’s ex girlfriend), Gazza and Tomlinson as witnesses for the Prosecution, make it almost impossible for Michael Kidd to get Mal and Shirl off. And the internal investigation into Steve Hennessey’s death is closing in on Peter Faithful and his team. A dramatic conclusion to this brilliant Australian television series. Contains some scenes in b&w. Cast also includes Chris Haywood, Simon Westaway, Jeremy Kewley, Felix Nobis, Louise Siversen, Brett Swain, Paulene Terry-Beitz, Leverne McDonnell, Belinda McClory and Victoria Eagger.

results.title: Just hold still. Parts one and two
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and colour and audio
results.brief_description: In his New York City Landscape, Cohen finds inspiration in disturbance. Looking to life for rhythm and to architecture for state of mind, he locates simple mysteries. `Just Hold Still’ is comprised of an interconnected series of short works and collaborations that explore the grey area between documentary, narrative and experimental genres. Part One concerns a personal, poetic approach to narrative while Part Two involves hybridized use of verite footage and the confrontation of documentary concerns with the music video format. The work can be considered as a whole or each piece in the project can be viewed (and rented) as a separate entity.

results.title: Janus. Eps 07 and 08: Without consent. Fail to appear
results.creator_credit: Julian McSwiney, Kate Woods, Bill Hughes and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Janus”.
Episodes 7 and 8 of the television series Janus. “Without consent” (52 mins) (directed by Kate Woods) sees Rob Griffin (Felix Nobis) taking a leading role for the Prosecution in a child sexual abuse case. Two young adult sisters claim that they were sexually abused as children by their uncle and are prepared to come to the stand and give evidence. In the meantime, Michael Kidd (Chris Haywood) files for a bail application for Steve Hennessey (Leon Teague) who is in remand on a drug trafficking charge. “Fail to appear” (51 mins) (directed by Julian McSwiney). The night before his court case, Steve Hennessey is charged and taken into custody by the Armed Robbery Squad for an Armaguard robbery. Conflict arises between Peter Faithful (Tactical Response Squad) and the Armed Robbery Squad over territorial rights to Steve Hennessey. Tina (Tracy Mann) faces an uphill battle prosecuting for a client, George Provis (John Paisley), who cannot remember how he was viciously assaulted at a shelter for homeless men. George is an alcoholic who suffers wandering thoughts and memory lapses. Contains some scenes in b&w. Cast also includes Simon Westaway, Jeremy Kewley, Louise Siversen, Robyn Butler, Tamara Saulwick, Brandon Burke, Aidan Fennessey.

results.title: Janus. Eps 19 and 20: Confess and avoid. A Prima facie case
results.creator_credit: Robert Klenner, Bill Hughes and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Janus”.
Episodes 19 and 20 of the television series Janus. “Confess and avoid” (48 mins) (directed by Robert Klenner) literally means confess to the lesser charges and hopefully avoid the serious charge. Michael Kidd has not lost a case in eight years but doubts start to set in when he finds himself defending a young law student, Ian Bisley (Richard Sutherland) who has been charged with culpable driving. Jenny Hanson (Jane Menelaus) as representative for the Crown Prosecution at the same time, is not looking forward to doing battle with the formidable Michael Kidd. “A Prima facie case” (48 mins) (directed by Julian McSwiney). Witnesses are called to give evidence at the commital hearing into Steve Hennessey’s death. Allegations are being made that Peter Faithful covered up for his mates and conflicting versions by the witnesses as to whether Steve Hennessey was armed, only complicates matters further. Peter Faithful decides to confront Michael Kidd’s allegations of persecution and corruption by taking the witness stand. Contains some scenes in b&w. Cast also includes Chris Haywood, Simon Westaway, Jeremy Kewley, Louise Siversen, Felix Nobis, Tamsin West, David Bradshaw and Steve Vidler.

results.title: Janus. Eps 01 and 02: Malice aforethought
results.creator_credit: Michael Carson, Bill Hughes and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Janus”.
A feature length episode sets the scene for this extraordinary courtroom drama series. The Supreme Court of Victoria provides the location for the opening shots of the four accused - Ken Hardy (Mathew Crosby), Steve Hennessey (Leon Teague), Darren Mack (Nique Needles) and Mal Hennessey (Brett Swain). The Hennessey’s are well-known for their notorious criminal activities and this time they are facing trial for an armed bank hold-up where one police officer has been shot dead and another seriously wounded. Lack of evidence and a technicality relating to the record of interview with Ken Hardy leaves the jury with no choice but to acquit the four men. This result shatters Det-Sgt Peter Faithful (Simon Westaway), who after the abandonment of the Major Crime Squad, spends time working in public affairs and a suburban CIB unit. Twelve months after the acquital Peter Faithful leaps at the chance to become involved with the Tactical Response Squad. Several intense months of surveillance on the Hennessey family finally begin to reap results for the frustrated Squad. Contains some scenes in b&w. Cast also includes Chris Haywood, Jeremy Kewley, Tracy Mann, Louise Siversen, Paulene Terry Beitz, Belinda McClory.

This result shatters Det-Sgt Peter Faithful (Simon Westaway), who after the abandonment of the Major Crime Squad, spends time working in public affairs and a suburban CIB unit. Twelve months after the acquital Peter Faithful leaps at the chance to become involved with the Tactical Response Squad. Several intense months of surveillance on the Hennessey family finally begin to reap results for the frustrated Squad. Contains some scenes in b&w. Cast also includes Chris Haywood, Jeremy Kewley, Tracy Mann, Louise Siversen, Paulene Terry Beitz, Belinda McClory.

results.title: Goldfinger
results.creator_credit: Ken Adam, Guy Hamilton, Albert R. Broccoli, Harry Saltzman, United Artists Corporation and Danjaq
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
In this non-stop action thriller, Sean Connery is Agent 007 and Gert Frobe is the notorious gold smuggler (appropriately named Goldfinger) who has initiated a cataclysmic scheme to raid Fort Knox and obliterate the world economy. James Bond, armed with his specially equipped Aston Martin and devilish good looks, must stop the plan by overcoming several perilous situations and outrageous adversaries, including Oddjob who kills with a toss of his lethal hat, and the sexy pilot, Pussy Galore, whose romantic feelings for Bond complicate her involvement in Goldfinger’s high-flying scheme. Cast includes: Sean Connery, Gert Frobe, Honor Blackman, Shirley Eaton and Bernard Lee as “M”.

results.title: Drink Deep
results.brief_description: Drink Deep is a lyrical vision of friendship, hidden secrets, and desires. Cohen uses several types of film image to add texture to the layered composition. Beautiful shades of grey, silver, black and blue echo the water, reminiscent of early photography and silverprints. Cohen says, “The piece was constructed primarily from footage I’d shot of skinnydippers at swimming holes in Georgia and rural Pennsylvania. It’s about water and memory and stories just submerged. It is also, in part, a response to thinking about censorship. I would say that Drink Deep is both unabashedly and deceptively romantic. Surface, flow, and undertow. What looks like paradise is always paradise lost.” Music composed by Stephen Vitiello and performed with Gabriel Cohen and Mary Wooten.

results.title: Janus. Eps 23 and 24: Breach of bond. An Unnatural act
results.creator_credit: Julian McSwiney, Robert Klenner, Bill Hughes and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Janus”.
Episodes 23 and 24 of the television series Janus. “Breach of bond” (48 mins) (directed by Robert Klenner). Shane Hennessey (Jonathan Kernut) has broken his 12 month bond and finds himself remanded in custody on charges of robbery causing injury intentionally, theft and possession of a drug of dependence. Once again he faces Glenda de Bono (Louise Siversen), the same magistrate who put him on a bond for his previous offences. Glenda de Bono also hears a case against a family of gypsies involving crystal balls, curses and large payments of cash. “An Unnatural act” (50 mins) (directed by Julian McSwiney) focuses on a disturbing case of incest where a father has allegedly raped his 10-year-old daughter. Michael Kidd acts as Defence Counsellor for the father with Tina Bertrum prosecuting on behalf of the daughter, Evie (Leah de Niese). Meanwhile an escaped prisoner who has been recaptured could be Peter Faithful’s answer to the final missing link in the murder case against Mal Hennessey. Contains some scenes in b&w. Cast also includes Chris Haywood, Simon Westaway, Jeremy Kewley, Tracy Mann, Paulene Terry-Beitz, and Ezra Bix.

results.title: Black Hole Radio
results.brief_description:
Over the past 20 years, filmmaker Jem Cohen has assembled a massive visual archive of Super 8 and 16mm by filming everyday images and experiences as he negotiates his way through the spaces of New York City. Filled with enigmatic glimpses, gestures and images seeming to come from half-remembered dreams, memories and snatches of conversations, this archive contains hints for unearthing the many secrets of contemporary metropolitan life.
In the mid 1990s Cohen encountered a series of advertisements for a New York City ‘Phone Confession Line’.To call in and confess was free; to listen cost money. Cohen acquired recordings of these taped confessions of murderous thoughts, desire and treachery, and used them to form the audio heartbeat of his video installation ‘Black Hole Radio’. Accompanied by ghostly Super 8 images filmed by the artist during his nocturnal wanderings, the installation reveals the anonymous lives and restless spirits that haunt the phonelines, televisions and sleepless nights of the city.
For this version of the installation, ACMI has worked with the artist to create a small confessional cell where images shimmer like paranoid hallucinations while disturbing whispers hang in mid-air, semi-publicly. The elusive images that linger on the edge of visual perception provide the evidence of Cohen’s investigation into the small confessed ‘crimes’: loving the wrong man, harbouring hatred or greed. Visitors leave ‘Black Hole Radio’ feeling the way they do when a shameful memory wakes them in the dead of night. Inside Cohen’s confessional, it is understood that it is both a privilege and a curse: to live as social beings and to know that isolation and forgetting can’t conceal the troubled heart of the city.

results.title: Goldeneye
results.creator_credit: Martin Campbell, Barbara Broccoli, Michael G. Wilson and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
When a deadly satellite weapon falls into the wrong hands, only Agent 007 (Pierce Brosnan) can save the world from certain disaster. Armed with his license to kill and his smooth talking ways, Bond races to Russia in search of the stolen access codes for “GoldenEye”, the devastating satellite weapon. James Bond is pitted against an enemy who knows his every movement, a former agent, 006, trained in exactly the same methods and who can anticipate his every move. Alec Trevelyan (Sean Bean), agent 006 is motivated by a hatred that goes back years. 006 is not the only person causing Bond grief, he also battles with his former compatriot’s stunning ally, Xenia Onatopp (Famke Janssen), who crushes victims between her shapely but deadly thighs.
